intro: Biarum bovei var. discolor, commonly known as the white-flowered Dutchman's pipe, is a rare and striking plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is characterized by its unique, tubular, white to greenish-white flowers. The plant has heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is notable for its deceptive appearance, as the flowers resemble female insects to attract male pollinators. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in many regions.
